Summary Heading: Excellent modern and great value hotel
Summary: Stayed 7 nights in a suite on the sixth floor and had a really great experience. Staff were really friendly on checkin and recognised that I was an IHG member which was a welcome change. The room was clean and pretty modern with lots of space and a comfortable bed. Breakfast was usual for the chain and staff continued to be friendly and helpful through the stay. Gym was fine but didn‚Äôt try the Local Fullerton area is nice with good restaurants and there is a Farmers Market and Target on the next block.  I will definitely be back but will stay on a lower floor next time as the only negative was high traffic noise. That said this is a general issue in LA wherever you stay.
Room tip: Ask for low floor and book a suite

Summary: Service was friendly and efficient. The room was clean and comfortable, with a small balcony with a table and two chairs. Breakfast was included and was fine. But, you could hear even normal conversation through the walls, which is kind of a deal breaker
Manager Response: Hi fancynancy84,  Thank you for writing us about your experience at Holiday Inn Express Fullerton Anaheim. Our hotel is the perfect place to rest and meet with new and old friends.  I read your remarks and am sorry for what happened. This is not what I expect our guests to experience and understand your thinking about it. I shares your comments with our managers and took action to avoid this from happening again.   I invite you to come and stay with us on your next travel.  Warm wishes,  Oscar C. Case Manager IHG Service

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: First time stay overnight on our monthly trips to Disneyland.  Check in was a breeze (we checked in after visiting the park), lobby bright and inviting with 24/7 coffee available.  Hotel was recently updated and room was renovated and very clean.  Bedding was very comfortable and while we could hear street noise as per other reviews, our room was generally quiet and we got a good nights rest. Only one elevator but we did not have any issue. Breakfast was great with scrambled eggs/egg whites omelets, fresh pancakes from the pancake maker as well as breads, fruits, yogurt, juices and more.  Plenty of seating for families.  Great staff and would definitely recommend!  Will definitely try and make this our standard place to stay each month we visit Disneyland.

Spoke on the phone with Kent, upgraded my room to a suite couldn‚Äôt have done it without him. I would want this guy on my team, lots of charisma his services while I‚Äôll be back to this hotel. This hotel is a mustday would stay here again, one of my best stays.

Summary Heading: Not my usual Holiday Inn Express experience
Summary: I spent years traveling for work and non-profits, Lately I've selected Holiday Inns.  I will not stay here again because:  1. I have never stayed at a Holiday Inn that did not have a  newspaper in the morning. 2. On the breakfast --  eggs were not very good,  3. The air conditioner had a constantly high pitch whine and was extremely noisy when 'when cooling' . 4.  Whatever the business was next door started making loud 'beep, beep, beep' truck backup noises and trash dumping noises very early (it was at least 7am) in the morning. I'm glad i was already up by 6am. 5. The front desk guy was on his phone almost constantly and not really paying attention to guests.  6. Only a 'scan' icon for the TV information.  No printed materials for anything was in the room. 7. Upside, the room

Stayed here in February, I will be moving out this way for a job and this was a central point to look for apartments.  Probably not your average customer here.  Think most stay here as a hotel that is kind of close to Disneyland which isn't too far down the road.  I did notice the hotel has shuttles to Disney.  Room was good.  Comfortable bed and a hot shower.  I had a hotel room that faced the highway and the noise wasn't really noticeable.    The only real drawback was the breakfast.  Most of the food was dry.  Though the cinnamon rolls were good.  Just not a fan of the breakfast buffet at this location in general.  Really the only complaint I would have.

Location is convenient just off the 91 freeway and Harbor Blvd. The place is always clean and well-kept, with plenty of free parking available (with pass displayed on dashboard). Our flight was moved up by the airline, so we arrived a couple of hours before the posted 3:00 check-in time. The guy at the desk went to go check if the room was ready and since it was, checked us in quickly, and all the while seemed genuine happy to do so. Everyone of the staff we've encountered in our 3 days here have been not just polite, but downright friendly. They have all been masked as well. The room is clean, the bed and sofa are both comfortable, there is lots of  counter space in the bathroom, and they have signs posted in all the public spaces regarding their cleaning practices as well as

My family was staying here for a wedding in the area last month. My husband and I stopped by this hotel to say hello to family and drive some of them over to the venue. We took the elevator up to the 4th floor where I got off to see one family member but my husband stayed on going up to the 7th floor to see another family member. A short time later he called my cell to say he was trapped inside with the elevator going up and down between 1st and 7th floors. The emergency stop button wasn't working. He tried the emergency intercom but got no response.  He then tried to call the hotel number and again no answer. I ran down 4 flights of stairs to the front desk, explained the situation and asked them to call for help. Both employees just looked at me then continued to check in

This is the closest IHG property near Placentia. Wish there was one closer.  Our room 714 was spacious for a two queen room, very quiet, and clean. Staff at front desk were especially helpful. Breakfast ladies really work hard to keep everything stocked and cleaned. Appreciated that. And they open at 6:00!  Could not find luggage cart when needed. People be considerate and bring these back to the lobby!!!!! Our room had a view of the fireworks at Disneyland in the distance and a small balcony to view.  We will continue to stay here when in the area.

We‚Äôve stayed here a couple times under different managers. It‚Äôs a great location just off hwy 91. It‚Äôs perfect for ride sharing to Disneyland, as it will cost about what you‚Äôd tip your shuttle driver if you stayed  closer to Disneyland. We find 91 convenient to Los Angeles attractions too.   There are also a great many restaurants within walking distance, including a fantastic breakfast/lunch place right across the street. We last stayed July 4th on the third floor and had a fine 180 degree view of fireworks constantly going off throughout our vista stretching out towards the distant mountains.   In short, we like and will be back.

We were here two nights and requested an upgrade. We were given room 302. The layout of our room and the hotel is different from Holiday Inn Express locations. That is because it was built as another hotel and changed to an IHG. Looks like upgrade took place recently. Our room was very spacious, had a large living area, a separate bedroom and a small balcony.  Room was very clean, linens and bed were good as well as towels. Some things have changed because of COVID, masks of course, no daily cleaning of rooms but you can ask for assistance if needed, breakfast is ordered night before from a menu and you pick up and take to your room. The Jimmy Dean sausage muffin was especially good, heating in the microwave one minute. Ask for extra Keurig cups if you need them. Lighting in

We recently stayed here while visiting the area. Kent was very helpful during our stay. Hotel was clean, and breakfast was good. Highly recommend for families. Very convenient daily shuttle to Disneyland.

First time we've stayed at this property. Mom lives just north on Harbor Blvd so it was very convenient. There are plenty of other places to stay in the area and we have tried several of them over the years.  Because the grounds and facility overall are very well maintained, along with a great room and service from all the staff, we will definitely be making this our go-to from now on. Our room was on the 6th floor and had a balcony overlooking the pool area and the adjoining Howard Johnson hotel, but made for a very pleasant coffee drinking location in the mornings. When we checked in to our room we couldn't make the air conditioner to blow anything but warm air. The temp in the room went from 73 to 76 in the matter of moments. Fortunately we were headed out anyway and stopped

We rented two rooms for a week. Visiting a sick relative in the area and did not want to bother the family. This is the only place that do not charge for parking and had free breakfast. Provided that it was very close to Disney, the price was excellent value. Breakfast was the usual Holiday Inn Express quality and variety. Sufficient and I especially fond of hard boil egg. (just put it in hot water to warm it up). They did not serve dinner but I saw many people bought food from other places and ate at the breakfast area, took advantages of their free coffee and tea. It was very nice of the hotel to allow this. We all have a good stay.

Summary Heading: First time stay, I recommend and will stay here again
Summary: I usually stay at another IHG property in Anaheim but chose to try this Holiday Inn Express. I was very impressed and thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. The staff is excellent, friendly and professional. My room was very nice, spacious and clean. It looks very modern and well appointed. I will definitely stay here again in the near future.

I picked this hotel because my family made a last minute trip to Disneyland, and on-campus hotels were exceptionally expensive.  We were happy that the park was VERY easy to get to and a short drive away.  Upon checking out of the hotel, I left my Disneyland baseball cap at the hotel.  The hat is important to me because I bought it during my honeymoon at Disneyland six years ago.  I didn't realize I left it there until I got home.  I called the hotel and the housekeeping staff did find my hat.  The Front Desk said they would send it to me, provided I arranged a shipping label.  I went to UPS.com and paid for shipping and emailed them a shipping label.  They promptly packaged the hat (with some housekeeping extras) and I received it a couple days later.  I was very happy that

We stayed here for a couple of nights while visiting Disneyland. The staff was always very polite and happy to help. We arrived early so our room wasn't ready but they stored our bags while we went and got something to eat and did a little shopping. It offers a free shuttle to and from Disneyland which was very convenient. There are a lot of shopping centers withing walking distance.  We got a great restaurant recommendation from one of the guys at the front desk. The bathroom's odor extractor did not work, we told the front desk but there was never a resolution on that.

Summary Heading: We were very happy with our 2 nights stay at this hotel
Summary: We had a nice sunny room and balcony on the 3rd floor. It overlooked the very large pool. We had a safe and the room was spacious and modern, and clean. Also quiet. The breakfast was a typical IHG. Which was fine.  The breakfast area was very clean and spacious.  We found all the staff very friendly. Parking was safe and easy to park. We did not visit DIsney World, but it is a perfect location for it. Shops near by etc.

Summary Heading: Just pay extra to stay elsewhere.
Summary: Horrible management last weekend because of awful communication within the staff and to me and my friends (the guests). There were issues with the accessible room and they had our information before we arrived but never contacted us and the shuttle that they provide, the wheelchair ramp was not working (we had friend in a wheelchair). When we arrived we were told we would be move to a regular room for the night and move back to the accessible room tomorrow, my friend the wheelchair said she actually prefer if we stayed in the regular room and this was told to M******, at the front desk at the time, so we wouldn't be in the accessible room.  Their supervisor, K***, asked for my contact info, said he'd find an accessible shuttle for us while we were at disneyland that day, I told
Manager Response: Hi brise3888,  Thank you for posting a candid feedback from your recent stay with us. I was concerned to see that you were not impressed with our property particularly with your accessible room and with the communication among our staff regarding your requests. We always aim to provide simple and smart accommodations for all of our guests that is why I regret to see that you did not have a great experience. I am truly sorry for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you during your stay and your comments will be shared with our management team for necessary improvements.  I also sent you a private message to follow up and I hope you can respond at our most convenient time.  Again, thank you for the review and for staying with us. I hope that you would still consider staying with us again in the future.   Mike F. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: This is one of those hotels where you can have a great experience or a really bad experience. We were in the middle. The staff was really helpful and nice. The breakfast was typical HI. The pool was a little sketchy so we used the HoJo pool next door. The only real problem was housekeeping. Two days we didn‚Äôt get our room serviced. The first day I caught it in time but day two we didn‚Äôt get back until 5:30pm. They tried to tell me I had the Shhhh sign out but that was not accurate. So my comment is go at your own risk. Might be great but might not.
Manager Response: Hello ccreese,  Thanks for staying with us and taking the time to share your thoughts. I am glad that you find our staff really helpful and nice. On the other hand, I'm sorry you were disappointed with housekeeping for not being able to service your room. Our housekeeping team has been looped of your review and I'm confident this will be improved to deliver complete guest satisfaction.  We hope you consider us again as pit-stop for your travel in case you're back in the area!  Thanks,  Ronald R. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I wish I was joking...but I'm not.   First the good. The staff was very friendly & worked quickly to fix the worst issue. The hotel has done what they could to remodel, but it didn't appear to originally be a HI. üòï  First problem was when we got into our room. Having driven several hours in summer temperatures, I thought the body sweat stench was my own when I arranged my personal items on the bedside table. We opened the window for a bit, closed it & cooled the room via the ac while we left to buy food.   I showered about 10 pm & quickly discovered the stench I smelled didn't come from me. It was comming from the hotel bed pillows!  Thankfully I'd brought one of my own freshly laundered pillows & I used that, but I really need 2 to sleep well. I woke up in the morning & my

From the time we were greeted at the reception desk until we left the next morning the staff could not have been  any nicer and efficient.  The gentleman who was working the afternoon of May 23rd (shame on me for not getting his name) could not do enough to make our stay wonderful.  What a great attitude he had!  As for the room, it was spotless and the bed very comfortable.  The breakfast was not lacking for anything.  Omlettes, pancakes, danish, fruit, cereals, juices and coffee.  Great location as well.  Not sure you can do better, especially for the price.

This hotel was all over the place in terms of quality and consistency, so I‚Äôll start with the positives. The location is incredibly easy to find with lots of signage from Harbor (which in retrospect may not be the best idea in terms of security; nor are the ‚Äòat your own risk‚Äô signs throughout the parking lot). Breakfast is served daily from 6 ‚Äì 10 am (an extra half hour is added on the weekends, and the cook is there the entire time from 5am until about 11, replenishing the food offered and cleaning up when needed). Staff was very friendly, even the third-party security company that was walking the perimeter late at night. Plenty of electrical outlets and the room itself was mostly clean (typical dirty floor, dust spots in the bathroom and bedroom counters); as were the fridge,
Manager Response: Hello M0mmyG,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback. In every visit, we'd love to see you smile. I guess we did it with our warm and welcoming staff, and with the great food, you were able to enjoy. I will be sending your commendation to our staff for a job well done. It was a good note that you find your room comfortable enough for a good stay.  It was a busy time at the hotel and parking can be a challenge. I am sorry that housekeeping missed the mark in providing clean, fluffy towels and not having the rooms in tip-top condition. I am also alerting them about the coffee cup trash on the 6th floor. Your suggestions about the housekeeping and parking notice are noted and I will be sharing those with our hotel management for review. I am also alerting our Maintenance team to check out the doors. I am sorry that the noise from other guest caused discomfort. All of these concerns will be shared with our team and we will continue to work on giving better guest experience.  It might not have been a great stay, but I hope you will give us a second chance in the future.   Safe travels,  Deborah R. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Reserved rooms at this hotel in Sept 2018 for a convention in March 2019. Upon modifying the reservations in February, was told they would no longer honor the confirmed reservation rate of $175/night and that the rate was now $480/night. Spoke with receptionist, front office manager and than General manager before being told that the owner would not honor our original rate and the best they could offer was a $50 discount bringing the price per night to $430/night (over 2x what we planned for). Learned all of this 3 days prior to our expected arrival, after spending thousands on flights and other travel expenses to bring our team to CA. I am amazed that a hotel under the IHG corporate banner would place their profits so highly over their customers and leave us, a team that has
Manager Response: Hi Caroline C,  Thank you for staying with us and for leaving a review on TripAdvisor.  I am sorry that you were let down by our hotel staff. I am also sorry to learn about what happened to your reservation. The experience that you described is not what we want for any of our guests.  I have taken note of your comments and shared them with our management team to review the procedures we have in place and make necessary improvements accordingly. I have also sent you a private message to get additional information about this matter.  Again, thank you for bringing this to our attention and I hope to hear from you soon.  Sincerely,  Ingrid V. Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: clean and quiet with courteous staff
Summary: I came to Fullerton with a colleague to attend a conference.  We arrived late and I was surprised when the front desk greeted me by name.  I suppose it was by process of elimination that I was the last one with a reservation who had not arrived yet.  Check-in was friendly and quick.  Lobby looked very clean and relatively new.    Room was clean with relatively new furnishings.  Well-appointed bathroom, as usual with Holiday Inn Express.  The one flaw was the heater was quite loud and kept turning on every 3-5 minutes.  There was a cold spell in SoCal so we needed the heat.  Luckily I brought my earplugs which only reduced the noise to be more tolerable but it was still loud.  Breakfast was good.  Another plus with Holiday Inn Express, which is why I like choose them.  I always

I stay at a bunch of hotels for business travel and rarely write a review because most of the time my experience is adequate.  However, I must give credit where credit is due, this property is extremely clean, organized, quiet, and I have not had a bad experience yet.  The front desk associate by the name of Marlene is professional, courteous and must be a dream for the management team.  I highly recommend this property for your vacation or business needs in Fullerton, CA

room was large, clean, well appointed with microwave & coffee pot. Free wifi & nice free breakfast. Polite  staff. Clean lobby & ample parking. close to freeway and restruants. somewhat hidden from view.

Made last minute reservations after an extra long day of moving my daughter into CSU Fullerton.  We were pleasantly surprised to get an upgrade to a king room with a very deep, large jacuzzi tub! which was so appreciated after a taxing day.  Clean ,well appointed room, helpful staff and convenient to CSU Fullerton.

The location was perfect for us, just off of the 91. The room was very nice and clean and well maintained. Quiet too. Friendly staff. Excellent free breakfast. Easy to get out onto Harbor because there is a light at the intersection.

The room was clean and included a microwave, refrigerator and coffee pot. The complimentary breakfast was very nice,  but the shuttle to Disneyland was not available when needed on return trips to the hotel.

We love staying at this hotel whenever we are in the Fullerton area.  We have had the pleasure of staying here a few times, and each time we have had a great experience.  The best part about the hotel is the staff.  Each staff member we have dealt with is super friendly, courteous, and professional.  We are always acknowledged when leaving the hotel and on our return.  Front desk manager, Tristan, goes above and beyond to assist us with whatever we might need to have an enjoyable stay.  Tristan's front desk staff, including Marlene, Kent, and Lucia are all a great asset to the hotel.  Each and every one of them are helpful, friendly, courteous, and a joy to deal with.   The rooms are always fresh and clean and well maintained.  Both Denice and Rodriga have assisted us when it

3 nights here with everything great. Excellent service (Cathy and Bryan) when we checked in Oct 18th, and stayed in double queen on 7th floor where we could see the fireworks from Disneyland. Room 708. Breakfast was excellent. Hot, fresh, and some incredible cinnamon muffins. Our room was a constant air comfort, and I do wish the tub water was hotter. Nice little patio off the room. Driving distance to downtown Fullertown which is a cute town to walk around.  Shuttle service to Disneyland is very accommodating, but there's 1 Shuttle for 3 hotels. If I go to LA area again, which J have no near plans, this is the place to stay. Photos show shuttle schedule. ADDITIONAL NOTE: If you are going to Disneyland, and have a disability, unless you are in a wheelchair there are NO benefits

Summary Heading: A Great Place to Celebrate....When You Need a Holiday!!!
Summary: We took a holiday. Took some time to celebrate. Just a few days out of life. It was so, so nice. We took time for the good times. Forgot about the bad times. It was a few days to come together, to release all the pressure. We had a holiday!!! It was a way to come together, so we could make everything better. We had a holiday!!!!    (from the lyrics of Madonna's Holiday).   Our stay at Holiday Inn was awesome.  Great staff, The room was nice and clean. The beds were very comfortable after long and exhausting days of fun. Breakfast was standard and fresh. In a great location. There were a few restaurants nearby. Amtrak was not too far. With the use of Uber, we were able to get a ride to the Fullerton Station and purchase tickets for a day trip to Los Angeles. And well, who can

Summary Heading: New interiors, friendly with free breakfast and free shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: We specifically chose this hotel because of the proximity to Disneyland and their free shuttle. The shuttle goes back and forth every 30-minutes in the morning and in the afternoons through the evenings. Disneyland is around 15-minutes away.   We got an extra large suite. Our bed was huge and very comfortable. Relaxing after a long day at theme parks and being in the LA area.   I really loved the new interiors of the room, especially the bench under the TV in the bedroom with the shelves. Nice dual functionality.  The front desk and maintenance staff were always very helpful and pleasant. Even at the face of an irrational, irate guest, they still managed to keep their cool.   Thank you for the pleasant stay!

Summary Heading: Hotel Chooses not to send reservation reminders; then strictly enforces their no show policy
Summary: I made a reservation way in advance of my planned travel. My plans got shifted by a week. I thought I had changed the reservation, but had not. I typically get welcome/reminder emails from the hotels I stay at, Not from this hotel. In stead I was checking my credit card purchases, the morning I was supposed to show up. Saw a charge from the hotel. Called the hotel at 9:00AM to let them no I had made a mistake and would not be there. I have talked to several folks at the hotel. So it is clear there policy is to not send a reminder and  then collect money from anyone who may forget they made a reservation.
Manager Response: Hi Anne E,  Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us on your most recent Fullerton trip.   It is always our hope that all of our guests have an amazing experience with us. Not only when you visit but also when interacting with our hotel staff. I am sorry there was a concern you mentioned. I understand you felt frustrated by the level of customer service delivered by our staff surrounding your reservation information or update. I want to assure you that I have forwarded your feedback to the Front Desk for corrections. In line with this, I have sent you a private message to ask more information about your booking.  Again, thank you for sharing your experience as I look forward to your response.  Regards,  Zel N. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: Everything was perfect. Good room condition, kind staffs, hot food for breakfast, great location, except one man at the front desk. He‚Äôs the one who acts like he‚Äôs ‚Äúcool‚Äù but actually a racist with zero respect to his customer. One day, the room wasn‚Äôt made when I came back to my room at noon, which I think is totally fine as long as it gets cleaned before the end of the day. Anyway, I went out again, came back at 5:30 pm, and the room was still messy. It seemed like the cleaning lady forgot to clean up my room. I told ‚Äúthe man‚Äù and after he checks with the housekeeping lady, he says ‚Äúyou had the shhhh sign on your door and that‚Äôs why they didn‚Äôt clean your room‚Äù. I said ‚Äúno‚Äù because I clearly remember that there was nothing on the door when I came back to my room at noon AND at

I liked it. The hotel was clean, close to alot of other businesses, had plenty of free parking, nice pool and contemporary decorated rooms. No dusty flowery bed covers thank you very much. For a standard 1 king bedroom, there was a writing desk and a comfy winged chair on a corner with a foot stool. Unfortunately, we were on the first floor close to the lobby so there was no view. Like at all. All i could see from the window was the parking lot. Theres a big tv of course, an iron, a small refrigerator and the bathroom was huge. Except it didnt lock and it was a sliding door...meaning, i dont know if you'd wanna bunk with someone you hardly know if you plan on pooping there and making bodily sounds and smells haha. It was super clean though with free toiletries and the bed was

Summary Heading: Cheap option, near Disneyland with free shuttle
Summary: Great no frills hotel near Disneyland. Chose to stay at this hotel, as we don‚Äôt spend a lot of time at the hotel when we‚Äôre in LA.   This hotel is fairly new and provides an hourly free shuttle service to Disneyland. The only downside is that the hotel only has one elevator, not sure who came up with that idea as you‚Äôre SOL if it breaks down.

Summary Heading: Newer hotel with a few issues...
Summary: After spending a week at this newer Holiday Inn Express, I found it to be quite a mixed bag.   Pros: Affordable for the area Friendly front desk staff Better than average free continental breakfast Hotel still "feels" new Ample parking Free hourly shuttle to Disneyland (8am to noon and 4pm to close)  Cons: Odd location on an alley behind a gas station and a rough looking sports bar/pool hall Shares amenities (pool, parking lot, Disneyland shuttle) with an old and run down looking Howard Johnson Single elevator for the 6-7 story hotel tower Housekeeping was less than stellar - hairs in the shower and footprints on the tile floor Despite being a newer hotel, all four of the USB wall outlets were bent inward behind the face plate and were not usable.   For the price I paid, it was

One elevator, no access to stairs (they were outside and locked) and housekeeping did not clean our room until 4pm. Pool is small with only one umbrella and very few chairs. Also they were going to close the pool at 5pm for ‚Äúmaintenance‚Äù on a Saturday and we had to complain to not get it closed. Breakfast area is okay.

Stayed here for 2 nights for soccer tourney. Only a few chairs for the pool area so it wasn‚Äôt comfortable. The staff didn‚Äôt seem to care. In addition, we left a small clothing item behind and we had to call 4 times to ask if housekeeping found it. Each time they said they‚Äôd call us back and never did. Once they found item, on 4th call, they wouldn‚Äôt send it to us and said we had to provide a carrier. We will not be staying here again...

Summary Heading: Great cheaper option than Disneyland Area
Summary: I came here on 2 occasions in May of 2018 and both was great. First trip was for a tattoo appointment from a friend in Santa Ana. Got it booked through Hotwire and skeptical at first it was really good. Front desk was nice and accommodating. Check in was no more than 15 minutes which was pretty good since I came directly at 3 PM.   Staff: Was always friendly and always greeted us with a Hello and Bye when we would pass through the lobby. Also by the check in desk, there's a little snack stand.  Room was great on both occasions. Clean and everything updated. Furniture and Beds were comfortable. New LED TV around a 32 inch. Outdoor closet with all the necessary utilites. Bathroom was clean. Big mirror with lighting all around. Sink was nice and large.   Parking: It's easy to find

Summary Heading: Hotel was comfortable and low cost
Summary: Not a bad place.  Convenient to basically everywhere (although it is really close to nowhere special).  The rooms were decent sized and comfortable, but we did notice that things are getting a little "frayed around the edges" (e.g., corners in the bathroom are in need of a good deep cleaning, especially in the tub; carpets are getting worn; wallpaper had started peeling in some places).

Recently stayed at thiw hotel. During the visit the shower door came out of the track. It fell into the shower. I didn't see any damage so I put it back in the track and left. They withheld 500 dollars from my credit card stating that I caused damage to their hotel and absolutely refused to refund it. I got IHG involved and they said there is nothing they can do. Avoid this hotel at all costs.

Newly renovated and in great shape. Two people stand out for great service, the manager Tristan, always there during the day greeting everyone. The second is Lourdes, super friendly and great service.

The hotel was extremely clean and the staff were friendly and very helpful. The complimentary breakfast was always hot and fresh. This hotel is located next to a lot of restaurants and stores and is a quick drive to the Disney area. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to everyone! There is also onsite laundry and free parking.

We had a great stay thanks in large part to Tristan.  He's a gem but the rest of the staff was excellent too.  Our room was spacious and clean.  We were able to walk to restaurants (I know walking in LA but there's lots of places right around the corner and across the street).  The hotel has easy access to Hwy 91 and I-5 and is close to Disneyland.  It's also centrally located if you are doing other things.  The next day we went to the Huntington Library and Gardens up near Pasadena and got there in about 35 minutes.  In all, a great place to stay.

This (newer) addition to the Holiday Inn Express family is a  very good one!   New hotel, with the latest decor and amenities.   Currently I would rate this at the top end of the Express family that I have been to in the past 4 years.  Hotel very clean, staff very friendly.   Plenty of parking as well.    Only a few miles from Disneyland, and they also have a free shuttle to/from the Disneyland Parks (not publicized on the web site for some reason).  All-in-all had a fantastic stay, and I'd definitely stay at this property in the future if I'm in the Anaheim/Fullerton area!

Summary Heading: Great hotel ... Tristan went above and  beyond ...
Summary: This is a great property ... extremely clean ... good location. Right next to the 91 ... but not far from the 57 and the 5 freeway. It felt extremely safe .... lots of security measures in place. There was a fridge and micro in room. The only "con" was that the water pressure was not great .. but, I was on the top 7th floor. The bed was comfortable ... the a/c-heat unit worked great. There was lots of counter space in the bathroom. Did I say clean?  : -) Clean, clean, clean --- awesome! I would stay again!

Three of us (one child, two adults) stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Fullerton in Jan 2018 for one purpose:  visiting Disneyland!  We greatly enjoyed our time at this facility, with the pleasant staff being the highlight of the experience.  The room was clean, comfortable, and we didn't have issues with extraneous noise.  Personally I didn't go for a swim in the pool but the 8 year old reports that it was "great!".  The beds were comfortable and we had great sleeps as a result.  I must say we also enjoyed the surrounding area, as there's lots of interesting shopping/dining within easy walking distance of the hotel.  Breakfast was free, and the fare was simple but good:  bacon, sausages, scrambled eggs, yogurt, fruit, cereals, and a pancake machine  :)  The coffee (available 24

This HIX location is a clean, modern facility. It has seven floors and one elevator. The elevator is clean, spacious, fast, and is equipped with state of the art controls. The front porch of the entrance has attractive blue accent lights and the interior hallways are brightly lit.  The lobby area is both  functional and attractive. The entire staff was friendly and accommodating.  The air in the corridors does have a slight dusty smell, as mentioned by another reviewer. It is probably due to the construction project underway on the first floor.  The room itself was large, with a work desk and an ergonomic office chair.  The room had indirect lighting fixtures which created a very pleasant atmosphere. However, there was no ceiling fixture, so the two lamps were the only general

Very nice location close to Disneyland and shopping centers including cosco.  Free shuttle to Disneyland, saves on $20 parking.  Better than average Hot Breakfast, most days had scrambled eggs, crisp bacon, sausages, biscuit and gravy.  Also yogurt, hard boiled eggs, cereal and warm cinnamon rolls. Weekends will be extra busy with young kids.  Request a quiet floor if needed.

This motel is obviously new and We couldn't fault the attitude of the management who let us check in early and the helpful attitude of the rest of the staff. The room was, as you would expect clean and tidy. We had no problems with noise. All in all a pleasant experience.
Manager Response: Dear leyhill,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  It was a pleasure having you as our guest.  Our goal is to provide the best service possible and we are thrilled to hear that we've achieved this goal!  We hope to see you again soon.   Sincerely,   Julio Flores General Manager Julio.Flores@hiefullerton.com

Summary Heading: Looked like a nice place but....... I thought one main reason to stay at a hotel was to SLEEP
Summary: This place LOOKED nice. The room was nice. The breakfast was actually better than average. BUT what I really wanted was a good night's sleep. The pool are was supposed to close at 10. The noise, large crowd, kids screaming, people in the pool making noise, people running and yelling past my room, all of this went on until 11:15. I called the desk a couple of times- they sent down "security", but the problem continued on and on until the "next shift" came on at 11. I "saw" the security person talking to the crowd, but I saw them stay in the pool and not disburse. At one point, one "excuse" I heard was that the  people didn't really understand English so they thought it was "ok" since it was "only 11." Well, I don't care if they are from outer space, the ONE thing a hotel should

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm, located in a good area of Orange County
Summary: Great location for access for everything in Orange County,  the 91 freeway close to the I5 and CA55 gave me access to Disneyland, New Port Beach, and Knott's Berry Farm.  The staff facilities were great!  I will stay here again!

We came in on a quick trip to stay before we went to Disney.   We were greeted well and hosted well. The lobby and rooms have recently been redone and were very comfortable and welcoming.   Kids thought the pool was fun.  Beds were very comfortable.  FREE SHUTTLE TO DISNEY  Free parking.  Great breakfast. (Pancake maker!)  Easy walk to Inn-N-Out, Marshall's, Sprouts and more.   We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend.

We came for some softball games and after searching for a few days on every travel app I had. I literally chose this place just a few hours before we made the drive. It was the best deal I could find that met my picky needs. (Room photos, free parking, free breakfast and location -15mile radius was my max)  Checking in / stay : We checked in around 9pm after our finishing our games. There's like 2 hotels side by side and I think there was a wedding reception or something so it took a minute for parking but we found a spot. We were greeted by the gentleman who checked us in. I feel horrible I forgot his name. Very friendly! Check in was easy and smooth. Lobby was bright and clean!   Our room was located on the first floor. Beds were comfy, pillows were marked firm/soft on

Wow! This the worst hotel/motel I have ever tried stayed in. I made a reservation for a room with two beds and when I arrived to check in, I was given a key to a room that was already occupied with sleeping guests! The front desk person insisted rudely that that the room was vacant despite the obvious people who were woken and probably frightened by being walked in on. He then tried to blame the housekeepers for his incompetence. Another room was offered to me, but for some reason, he was not able to issue any key cards to this room. Being pretty late and tired, I accepted that he just let me in the alternative room without having a key only to find that there was some damage, a missing TV with only a mount on the wall and a broken air conditioner that did not work. It was well

Checked in 7/12/17 in the evening, room was okay, comfortable beds, but very high, almost had to jump up to get into bed. Did not sleep well, room was very noisy & could hear all traffic from road & outside. View was towards the pool & Howard Johnson Hotel next door. The next morning we went to breakfast, it was hot & okay, but a lot was to be desired...no sausage, no biscuits & gravy, no bananas, super basic. Upon finishing breakfast we gathered our room key & decided we'd take the hotel shuttle to Disney to avoid parking fee's & driving in traffic. The shuttle driver appeared to be very "short-kinda rude" in attitude. He walked in the hotel doors & called out one time "last call for Disney" did a half way turn & out the door he went. So we quickly got on the shuttle as we

We came for a softball tourney. We spent many days researching and comparing hotels in the area. We ended up only needing one night stay. We were won over on the phone setting up a block of rooms with Kent, the hotel manager. Check-in was great! Kent was also there to make sure it went smooth. Even offered a one room upgrade and dinner information. Fast and easy. It's a new hotel, and the building and furnishings were excellent. We stayed at the top floor (7 floors) and were awarded the King Suite. VERY IMPRESSIVE. Two rooms, nice setup with plenty of room, and a comfortable pullout couch. Large balcony! We were able to invite the rest of the team to eat in the "living room" and watch the Disneyland fireworks from the balcony! The king bed was new and comfy. It was a GREAT stay!

Chose this hotel for one night as we are IHG elite members and we were in the Fullerton area for the day. Confusing checking in. Saw the large Holiday Inn Express sign on the building but all the signage was for Howard Johnson's. Security guard in parking lot directed us to the check-in lobby. Turned out it was for Howard Johnson's. The Holiday Inn Express check-in was next door, 8 ft away.  Turns out the Holiday Inn Express just opened 2 weeks ago and is owned by the same owner as the Howard Johnson's next door and it used to be part of the Howard Johnson's. We were impressed by the king suite we received on the top floor. It was a mini-apartment, had two rooms and a long balcony which overlooked all of south Orange County, even Disneyland which we were able to watch their
